description: Unique identifier for this configuration record.
Default state or province prefilled on new work requests.
Default city prefilled on new work requests.
Pattern or prefix used to generate work request numbers.
Most recently assigned sequential work request number used to determine the next.
Default target completion window in days promised to the requester.
Flag indicating whether a submitted request must be approved before work proceeds.
Distance threshold used by automatic duplicate detection for nearby requests; confirm units with SME.
Time window used to consider earlier requests as potential duplicates.
Rule for how detected duplicates are automatically handled (e.g., flag, merge, close); confirm behavior with SME.
User who created this configuration record.
Timestamp when this configuration record was created.
User who last updated this configuration.
Timestamp of the most recent configuration update.
Default maintenance or operations group assigned to new work requests.
Message template used to notify that approval is required; confirm audience with SME.
Message template for a closure notification (scope may differ from tmp_wr_closed; confirm with SME).
Message template confirming a new work request was created.
Message template informing that a request was denied.
Message template notifying a change to the promised completion date.
Message template sent for password reset or recovery.
Message template used for supervisor notifications; confirm exact triggers with SME.
Message template sent when a work order is created from a request.
Setting that permits submitting requests without authentication.
Message template inviting the requester to complete a satisfaction survey.
URL of the image displayed as the banner on the survey.
Message template sent when an operation/location is selected on a request; confirm event semantics with SME.
Message template sent when an issue/category is selected; confirm event semantics with SME.
Message template for notifying assignment of the request to a technician or team.
Notification recipients or rule for the operation-selected event; confirm storage format with SME.
Notification recipients or rule for the issue-selected event; confirm storage format with SME.
Notification recipients or rule when a request is assigned; confirm storage format with SME.
Message template for assignment notifications sent to the supervisor.
Message template for notifying the requester that the work request is closed.
Notification recipients or rule when a supervisor is assigned; confirm storage format with SME.
Notification recipients or rule when a request is closed; confirm storage format with SME.
If enabled, users can add new requests but cannot edit existing ones.
If enabled, users may append comments but cannot modify previous comments.
If enabled, users may append notes but cannot edit existing notes.
Message template used when request comments change.
Message template used when request notes change.
Notification recipients or rule when request comments change; confirm storage format with SME.
Notification recipients or rule when request notes change; confirm storage format with SME.
Message template used when a request’s status changes.
Notification recipients or rule when a request’s status changes; confirm storage format with SME.
Number of days to wait after completion before sending the survey.
Header text displayed at the top of the survey.
Reference to the stored logo image attachment used in the requester portal or emails.
Controls whether a work order is automatically created from a new request.
Notification recipients or rule for anonymously submitted requests; confirm storage format with SME.
If enabled, bypasses the preview step during request submission.
Days after the initial event to send the first reminder notification; confirm event with SME.
Days after the first reminder to send the second reminder; confirm event with SME.
Message template sent for user registration or account activation.
Message template for repeated assignment reminder notifications.
Controls whether an Approve action is available in the requester portal.
Controls whether a Deny action is available in the requester portal.
Minimum allowed password length for requester accounts.
Password complexity requirement code (e.g., mix of cases, digits, symbols); confirm encoding with SME.
Number of failed login attempts allowed before account lockout.
Policy flag indicating whether consecutive identical characters are permitted in passwords.
